availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Jabez D. Pratt (Baltimore County, Maryland, attorney. )

body.p: Baltimore County, Maryland, agent and commissioner of deeds. Suffolk County, Massachusetts, native. Married to Mary C. Kowse in Suffolk County, Massachusetts, on March 7, 1840. Father of Joseph Pratt and Charles Pratt. Married to Lucy S. Buck Pratt in New Haven County, Connecticut, on September 30, 1848. Father of Albert Pratt, Frank Pratt, Baron Pratt, and Louis. Agent in Baltimore County, Maryland, in 1850. Agent in Baltimore County, Maryland, in 1860. Employed Ann Somers, Bridget Somers, Kate Katcher, and Nathan Loney as servants in Baltimore County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore County, Baltimore, Ward 14, p. 429B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore County, Baltimore, Ward 20, p. 208.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore County, Baltimore, Ward 12, p. 286A.
Massachusetts, U.S., Town and Vital Records, 1620-1988, Boston, Marriages, 1800-1849, Vol. 2, pp. 209-210.
"Marriages," The Hartford Courant (Hartford, CT), October 12, 1848.
"Jabez D. Pratt (1819-1865)," Find A Grave, Memorial #35496322, accessed June 24, 2022, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/35496322/jabez-d-pratt.
